Package algorithms.trees

Class TDP_PartPlus

  • java.lang.Object
    • algorithms.trees.TDP_Iterator
      • algorithms.trees.TDP_Anyk_Iterator
        • algorithms.trees.TDP_PartPlus
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    TDP_QuickPlus
    public abstract class TDP_PartPlus
extends TDP_Anyk_Iterator
    Implementation of Anyk-PartMemoized for DP, a ranked enumeration algorithm that improves upon DP_Part by adding certain memoization. In particular, we store the order that a prefix explores a subspace and then reuse that order for other prefixes too. The data structures needed to for memoization are contained in entities.paths.DP_SuffixMemoizer. One such object is pointed to from each DP_DecisionSet.
    Author:
    Nikolaos Tziavelis

    • Field Detail

      • global_pq

      • iteration_no

        private long iteration_no
        Keeps track of how many results have been returned.

      • independence_points

        List<Boolean> independence_points
        Stores for every stage whether it is an independence point for the tree. This means that given a node of that stage, the prefixes and suffixes are independent. With a BFS ordering, this corresponds to the last stage of every level.

    • Method Detail

      • get_next

        public TDP_Solution get_next()
        For this algorithm, the expansion, successor-taking and following steps are combined. As a result, it is difficult to return a popped result as soon as possible. To emulate the behavior of other any-k algorithms, return the top-1 result immediately (known from bottom-up DP) and then call the regular get_next method from the 2nd iteration onward.
        Specified by:
        get_next in class TDP_Anyk_Iterator
        Returns:
        TDP_Solution The next best T-DP solution or null if there are no other solutions.

      • get_next_helper

        public TDP_Solution get_next_helper()

      • follow_leading_prefix

        private void follow_leading_prefix​(TDP_Prefix_Solution_Follower follower,
                                   TDP_DecisionSet decs)
        Makes a given prefix "follow" the leading prefix that ends on the same decision set. Specifically, we find the next best suffix from the sorted list of suffixes discovered by the leading prefix. If it hasn't been computed yet, we make the given prefix wait until it has (a subscriber).
        Parameters:
        follower - A prefix solution that is a follower.
        decs - The decision set where the data structures related to the prefix are stored.

      • record_suffixes

        private void record_suffixes​(TDP_Prefix_Solution prefix,
                             TDP_Suffix_Solution suffix,
                             TDP_DecisionSet decs)
        Records a suffix as the next best option in the sorted list of suffixes at the end of the given prefix.
        Parameters:
        prefix - The prefix that will store the suffix.
        suffix - The suffix that will be stored.
        decs - The decision set where the data structures related to the prefix are stored.

      • expand

        protected TDP_Prefix_Solution expand​(TDP_Prefix_Solution pref)
        Expands the prefix solution into a full solution by following an optimal sequence of decisions. The full solution reaches a terminal node for each leaf stage.
        Parameters:
        pref - A prefix solution to be expanded optimally.
        Returns:
        TDP_Prefix_Solution A new object that is a full solution.

      • initialize_partial_order

        public abstract void initialize_partial_order​(TDP_DecisionSet decisions)
        Initialization of the data structures needed at each TDP_DesicionSet in order to compute a partial order among decisions.
        Parameters:
        decisions - The set of decisions whose data structures will be initialized.

      • get_successors

        public abstract List<TDP_Decision> get_successors​(TDP_Decision dec)
        Find the successors of a given decision among the other decisions in the TDP_DecisionSet. The way that successors are computed depends on the variant (subclass).
        Parameters:
        dec - The decision whose successors will be computed.
        Returns:
        TDP_Decision The successor decisions according to the (partial) order.

      • initialize_data_structures

        public void initialize_data_structures()
        Initializes the data structures needed for all nodes. Visits all the nodes in a DFS traversal.
